title: external filesystem owncloud: folders as files
body:
i have two 5.0.7 owncloud instances, and i mounted one inside the other.  when i log into owncloud, i see instance 1 as the default, and then a folder mounting the second instance called betaowncloud.

all appears ok, i have a beta instance, etc, and everything works well until that second instance gets too big.  this leads to 1 of 2 outcomes.
1) the second instance, with 50 folders, 1 gb of data, and maybe 150 files, mounts, but all the folders look like files, and all the files have size zero
![webdav mount failure](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/1818977/669951/768d5eda-d838-11e2-8b25-ea929026f780.png)
and then an attempt to upload a file tells me cloud not found:
![webdav mount failure error](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/1818977/669956/94f6af5c-d838-11e2-9a14-521c1591ba7a.png)
or
2) i get a white screen and nothing else happens

i think this is because the external storage app is taking too long, or has too much to do to scan the external filesystem, and it can't display while also scanning in the background.

i can mount webdav and owncloud that is smaller, of course.  that is fast enough.

opensuse 12.3, using windows 7 firefox, connecting to the back end.
